Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: 2ND INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not after); MIDDLE KINGDOM (not before)
Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; ENGOBE
Name: Vase
Description: This vessel was found amongst a set of offerings placed in the coffin of a modest burial. With its spherical body, curved neck and orifice flared like the corolla of a flower, it is reminiscent of the golden examples of the Second Intermediate Period. This particular vessel has been polished. The clay is fine, orange and covered with a red slip.
